summary: Expand editor to full viewport width with minimal chrome in default view
problem_statement: The current layout constrains the writing surface and keeps metadata, controls, and chrome visible by default. Writers need a thinking environment where the editor dominates the viewport and peripheral UI recedes. A narrow or cluttered default view increases cognitive load and undermines the attention-protecting promise of the platform.
in_scope: Expand editor content area to full viewport width
Reduce or hide non-essential chrome in the default Write view
requirements: Editor uses full viewport width in default Write view
Visible chrome in default view is minimal (≤5 controls per epic DoD)
No regression in time to first keystroke or input latency
acceptance_criteria: Editor content area spans full viewport width
No measurable regression in typing performance
risks: Full-width layout may expose responsive edge cases on narrow viewports
Reducing chrome could hide controls users expect to find
implementation_notes: P1-uix-01 is the first structural change in the Attention-First UIX epic. Focus on layout and viewport usage; metadata and controls move in P1-uix-02. Reference epic DoD: cognitive load ≤5 visible controls, time to first keystroke <100ms perceived.
